explanation: The report is correct. In a build/configuration where all algorithm branches are excluded by the preprocessor the function body becomes mhd_assert(0); followed (in a _DEBUG build) by da->hashing = false;. If mhd_assert(0) is implemented as a failing assertion that does not return (typical debug assert handlers call abort and thus never return) the assignment after it can never be executed — it is unreachable. MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code in the project, so this configuration constitutes a violation. (If the project guarantees the assert handler may return, the statement might be reachable; however the scenario as stated — a non‑returning failing assert — makes the report correct.)
